title: Shona - John (Print)
description: Shona is a Bantu language of the Shona people of Zimbabwe. It was codified by the colonial government in the 1950s. According to Ethnologue, Shona, comprising the Zezuru, Korekore and Karanga dialects, is spoken by about 7.5 million people. The Manyika dialect of Shona is listed separately by Ethnologue, and is spoken by 1,025,000 people.

language.name: Shona
language.area: Mashonaland, central, and widespread throughout the country. Also in Botswana, Malawi, South Africa, Zambia.
